Key Arguments: The bill undermines freedom of speech and disregards the rights of Australian citizens.
It creates a two-tiered system privileging politicians, journalists, and educational institutions over ordinary citizens.
Excessive fines will have a chilling effect on freedom of speech, leading to overly restrictive digital services.
It is impossible to accurately judge truth as new information constantly emerges.
The bill could lead to anti-competitive practices benefiting large digital services and hindering new entrants.
The broad definitions and extraterritorial application of the bill pose risks to global internet freedom.
Notable Quotes: It is deeply concerning to witness the Australian Government disregard the fundamental principles of freedom of speech.
The billâ€™s excessive fines will undeniably have a chilling effect on freedom of speech.
The proposed legislation is wholly undemocratic.
